Front: Create logical volume 'lvdata' of 2GB in vgdata
Resize ext4 filesystem after extending LV
Resize XFS filesystem after extending LV
Set SELinux to permissive mode temporarily
Set SELinux to enforcing mode permanently
View SELinux context of a file
View SELinux denials in audit log
Check all SELinux denials from boot time
Generate policy module from specific command denials
Create readable policy suggestions from recent denials

Front: Search for package containing a file
Schedule a job to run at 2:30 AM daily
Add a cron job for user alice
List cron jobs for current user
Copy SSH public key to remote server
Connect to server via SSH with specific key
View running processes by CPU usage

Back: Add 'single' to kernel parameters in GRUB
Boot to rescue, mount filesystems, chroot, passwd

Front: Configure static IP 192.168.1.100/24 and DNS 8.8.8.8 using nmcli on connection 'ens33'
Back: nmcli con modify ens33 ipv4.addresses 192.168.1.100/24 ipv4.dns 8.8.8.8 ipv4.method manual && nmcli con up ens33
Notes: Note: ipv4.method manual is required for static IP

Front: Create podman container running nginx, map port 8080->80, auto-start with systemd
Back: podman run -d --name web-server -p 8080:80 nginx && podman generate systemd --new --files --name web-server && sudo cp container-web-server.service /etc/systemd/system/ && sudo systemctl enable container-web-server.service
Notes: New RHCSA requirement - containers with systemd integration

Front: Boot into rescue mode to reset root password on RHEL 9 (GRUB method)
Back: At GRUB menu: e -> find linux line -> add rd.break at end -> Ctrl+X -> mount -o remount,rw /sysroot -> chroot /sysroot -> passwd -> touch /.autorelabel -> exit -> exit

Front: Allow httpd to bind to port 8080 with SELinux (without disabling)
Notes: Use semanage, not setsebool for port binding

Front: Create LV, extend it by 500MB, and grow XFS filesystem in one sequence
Back: lvcreate -L 1G -n data vg01 && mkfs.xfs /dev/vg01/data && mkdir /data && mount /dev/vg01/data /data && lvextend -L +500M /dev/vg01/data && xfs_growfs /data
Notes: Remember: XFS uses xfs_growfs, not resize2fs

Front: Configure autofs to mount NFS share 192.168.1.100:/exports to /mnt/nfs
Back: echo '/mnt /etc/auto.nfs --timeout=60' >> /etc/auto.master && echo 'nfs -rw 192.168.1.100:/exports' >> /etc/auto.nfs && systemctl enable autofs && systemctl start autofs

Front: Find all SUID files on system (exam-safe performance)
Notes: Redirect stderr to avoid permission noise

Front: Configure cron job for user alice to run backup.sh every Tuesday at 3:15 AM
Set up SSH key authentication and disable password auth
Back: ssh-keygen -t rsa && ssh-copy-id user@server && echo 'PasswordAuthentication no' >> /etc/ssh/sshd_config && systemctl reload sshd
Notes: Don't forget to reload sshd after config change

Front: Create swap file (not partition) of 1GB and enable permanently
Back: fallocate -l 1G /swapfile && chmod 600 /swapfile && mkswap /swapfile && swapon /swapfile && echo '/swapfile swap swap defaults 0 0' >> /etc/fstab
Notes: Swap files are valid - know this alternative

Front: Troubleshoot: service fails to start, check SELinux denials
Back: systemctl status servicename && journalctl -u servicename && ausearch -m AVC -ts recent
Notes: Check all three: systemctl, journalctl, ausearch

Front: Set user password to expire in 90 days, warn 7 days before, min 1 day between changes
Open firewall for HTTP, HTTPS permanently and reload
Reset forgotten root password using single user mode (systemd method)
Back: At GRUB: e -> linux line -> add systemd.unit=rescue.target -> Ctrl+X -> enter root password -> passwd -> systemctl default
Notes: Systemd method - know both rd.break and rescue.target

Front: Mount NFS share temporarily and add to fstab for permanent mounting
Notes: Test mount first, then add to fstab

Front: Create user with specific UID 5000, home dir /opt/appuser, shell /sbin/nologin
Notes: -m creates home dir, even if custom location

Front: Check which process is using port 80
Notes: Know both ss and lsof methods

Front: Find files modified in last 7 days in /var/log
Enable and start httpd, then check if it's listening on port 80
Notes: --now enables and starts in one command

Restore SELinux contexts for entire /var/www directory
Configure rsyslog to log all mail facility messages to /var/log/mail.log
Change process priority of PID 1234 to nice value 10
Configure autofs timeout of 30 seconds for all mounts
Back: Edit /etc/auto.master, add --timeout=30 to master map entries

Notes: % indicates group, NOPASSWD removes password requirement
Complex but useful for disk space issues

Front: Create swap partition on /dev/sdb1 and activate

Back: Create /etc/logrotate.d/myapp: /var/log/myapp.log { weekly rotate 4 compress missingok notifempty }

Front: Configure network bond with ens3 and ens8 as slaves
Back: nmcli con add type bond con-name bond0 ifname bond0 && nmcli con add type ethernet slave-type bond con-name bond0-slave1 ifname ens3 master bond0 && nmcli con add type ethernet slave-type bond con-name bond0-slave2 ifname ens8 master bond0
